title: Proclamation Designating Thanksgiving Day, 2025 as a National Day of Thanksgiving
summary: A presidential proclamation designates Thanksgiving Day, 2025 as a national day of thanksgiving. The document situates the holiday within American history, citing that the first National Day of Thanksgiving was established in 1789 by President George Washington and describing it as a duty of nations to acknowledge Providence, to obey divine will, and to be grateful for blessings. The proclamation invites public reflection on gratitude and the contributions of others, and aligns the observance with the longstanding tradition of observing a day of thanksgiving.

title: Proclamation on the Role of Steel and Regulatory Relief for Certain Stationary Sources to Promote American Coke Oven Processing Security
summary: This proclamation issued by the President describes steel as a vital material for the U.S. economy and daily life, noting its use in infrastructure, manufacturing, transportation, energy systems, military hardware, and other products that contribute to economic output. It also references regulatory relief for certain stationary sources intended to promote American coke oven processing security, as described in the linked presidential action page.

title: Nominations Sent to the Senate for ATF Director, EEOC General Counsel, and CFPB Director
summary: The White House announced that nominations have been sent to the Senate for several federal appointments. Included are Robert Cekada of Florida as Director of the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives; Carter Crow of Texas as General Counsel of the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission for a four-year term; Stuart Levenbach of Maryland as Director of the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection for a five-year term; and David Clay Fowlkes, among others listed in the release.

title: Proclamation Designating November 2025 as National Adoption Month
summary: This proclamation designates November 2025 as National Adoption Month and emphasizes the importance of providing safe, nurturing homes for children in need. It notes that adoption offers stability and belonging, and it recognizes the roles of adoptive families, prospective parents, and the broader community in supporting children's well-being. The text calls on federal, state, and local agencies, along with organizations and individuals, to observe National Adoption Month, promote awareness of adoption options, assist families through supportive services, and reduce barriers to the adoption process.

title: Executive Order on Fostering the Future for American Children and Families
summary: This executive order establishes the administration's policy to support family stability and child well-being by empowering parents to raise children in safe and loving homes. It directs federal agencies to coordinate efforts to assist families during crises, strengthen the foster care system when family arrangements are disrupted, and enhance oversight, services, and resources for caregivers and children to promote safety and stability. The order outlines actions to improve interagency coordination, data sharing, and compliance with applicable laws to support children and families across the United States.
